hero.title: Szczerbatek
hero.description: Our flagship plane is named 'Szczerbatek' (pronounced 'Sh-cher-ba-tek', meaning 'Toothless' in Polish - yes, we know it's a tongue twister!). A versatile aircraft designed for autonomous flight, data collection, and maybe even making dentists nervous.

ourSolutions.title: Our Solutions
ourSolutions.description: We build it. We code it. We fly it.

aero.title: Analisysis and design
aero.description: Initial design and aerodynamic calculations for our aircraft.

laminating.title: Laminating
laminating.description: Carbon fiber composite for robust construction.

onboardElectronics.title: Onboard electronics
onboardElectronics.description: Tested components for reliable control and safe flight.

programming.title: Programming
programming.description: Visual recognition system for highest mission performance.

cncMilling.title: CNC milling
cncMilling.description: Precision manufactured moulds for high quality construction.

fusion.title: Fusion-based 3D modeling
fusion.description: Designing the aircraft in a 3D environment to ensure precision and accuracy.

timeline.title: Our Journey
timeline.description: The evolution of the Szczerbatek project through time

items.title: Initial Discussions and Planning
items.description: The team holds first coordination meetings. Objectives are set, responsibilities assigned, and a general project roadmap is outlined. The vision of the project is created.

items.title: Conceptual Design Phase, Aerodynamic and Structural Calculations
items.description: Development of the aircraft concept begins. Core structural layout, control surfaces, and configuration are sketched. Aerodynamic simulations of the wings and fuselage are performed. Fusion-based 3D modeling of the aircraft structure is undertaken.

items.title: Selection of Onboard Electronics and Materials, Power Requirement Calculations
items.description: The team selects appropriate onboard electronic systems (flight controllers, sensors, telemetry modules) and materials (composites, resins) based on mission criteria and weight/power efficiency. Detailed calculations of total power needs are conducted, including propulsion, onboard systems, and mission-specific devices.

items.title: Air Drop System and Retardant Mechanism Design, Execution and Testing
items.description: Design begins on the payload delivery system and retardant mechanism deployment, focusing on precision, weight, and reliability. The mechanical components of the air drop system mechanism are built, tested, and refined.

items.title: Mold CNC Milling, Software Design
items.description: High-precision CNC milling of molds for aerodynamic parts (wings, fuselage shells) is completed. The team begins designing software solutions.

items.title: Laminating Process
items.description: Composite lay-up and vacuum-assisted lamination of the aircraft components are carried out using selected materials.

items.title: Electronics and Telemetry System Implementation
items.description: Physical integration and wiring of electronic components, telemetry modules, sensors, and flight controllers into the aircraft.

items.title: Software Implementation
items.description: Uploading and testing custom software solutions, including algorithms for terrain mapping and autonomous release systems.

items.title: Final Aircraft Improvements
items.description: Based on prototype testing, design tweaks are implemented to optimize flight stability, payload capacity, and overall mission performance.

items.title: Outdoor Flight Testing
items.description: Field tests are conducted to validate aircraft performance, test drop mechanisms, and collect telemetry data in real conditions.

items.title: Software Adjustments
items.description: Bug fixes, code optimization, and final software updates based on flight data and performance logs.

items.title: Mission Performance and Team Communication Tests
items.description: Simulated mission runs are performed to verify teamwork efficiency, communication protocols, and mission execution.

items.title: Final Tests during Droniada event
items.description: Final full-scale tests are conducted under conditions replicating the competition during the Droniada event.

team.title: Meet Our Team
team.description: The passionate individuals behind the Szczerbatek project, bringing together diverse skills and experience to solve challenging problems and deliver innovative solutions.

iza.name: Izabella Rosikoń
iza.description: Manages workflow and coordinates team efforts to ensure efficient and timely task execution.

kacper.name: Kacper Krempa
kacper.description: Operates UAVs, ensuring accurate and safe flight missions. Responsible for the design of the plane.

roza.name: Róża Łopusiewicz
roza.description: Helps with technical documentation and construction tasks, applying experience gained as an aerospace engineer.

sebastian.name: Sebastian Bucior
sebastian.description: Responsible for planning and executing the lamination process.

krzysztof.name: Krzysztof Piekarski
krzysztof.description: Specializes in 3D printing solutions and the design of the drop system.

piotr.name: Piotr Kur
piotr.description: Operates CNC machines, ensuring accuracy and quality in the manufacturing process.

filip.name: Filip Kulka
filip.description: As Main Ground Station Operator, ensures safety during flight missions.

wojtek.name: Wojciech Wiszniewski
wojtek.description: Manages and ensures the reliability of the communication unit between the UAV and ground station during operations.

lukasz.name: Łukasz Bogacz
lukasz.description: Implements software to ensure stable and precise UAV flight control.

ignacy.name: Ignacy Kępa
ignacy.description: Responsible for integration of onboard electronics.

filipG.name: Filip Gajda
filipG.description: Oversees the design and integration of electronic systems and power solutions to ensure optimal performance and reliability.

marta.name: Marta Łopusiewicz
marta.description: Responsible for drop system software and technical documentation of the project.

radek.name: Radosław Benedykciński
radek.description: Software developer specializing in visual recognition systems.

organization.title: Part of AGH Solar Plane
organization.description: Szczerbatek is being developed by AGH Solar Plane - a student organization dedicated to pushing the boundaries of solar aviation. Join us in our mission to revolutionize sustainable flight.
